content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, x times the natural log of x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mi>ln</mi><mo>‚Å°</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x is greater than 0 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. On what open interval is <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> decreasing?

choices.label: <math alttext="0 is less than x, which is less than 1 over e " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math> only
<math alttext="0 is less than x, which is less than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>
<math alttext="x is greater than 1 over e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0 is less than x, which is less than 1 over e " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math> only

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
